page.title: 05WALLASTON FARM, HUNDLETON
page.content: Wallaston Farm is run by Mr Harries, and is a dairy farm of 300 acres, 285 of which are arable. These are used to grow barley (10 acres) and grass for grazing (275 acres). Cattle on the farm consist of 200 Friesians, 80 Herefords and some Charolais. Of other animals there are 100 ewes, 150 lambs and 2 thoroughbred race horses. Besides the manager there are 2 general farm workers, who use 3 tractors,1 plough, 3 rollers, 1 seed-drill, 1 disc harrow, 2 dung spreaders, 1 mechanical loader, 1 fertilizer spreader, 1 mower, 1 swathe turner, 1 baler, 1 crop sprayer, 1 milking machine and 1 chain harrow. Calving time in October and November is the busiest time, followed by silage-harvesting time. Mr Harries has lived on the farm for 40 years and enjoys farming.
